text: Is there any good equivalent to java's interfaces? I'm trying to create a generic skip list, and I want to make sure that the elements are comparable. I know that method_exists() works, but I'm not sure how I can make the type of a struct a type that contains the method. i.e is there something like <V extends comparable> from java in julia?

elements.text: Is there any good equivalent to java's interfaces? I'm trying to create a generic skip list, and I want to make sure that the elements are comparable. I know that method_exists() works, but I'm not sure how I can make the type of a struct a type that contains the method. i.e is there something like <V extends comparable> from java in julia?

text: Currently the only answer is to assume it works. If it doesn't there will be an error saying that there is no definition. (that said, in the case of `==`, this should never be the case. There is a fallback defined in base that uses pointer comparison).
